snippet: Hurricane Sandy took a tremendous toll in Ortley Beach, N.J., but for some, the pain was tempered by the loss of life at Sandy Hook Elementary in Connecticut.
abstract: Ortley Beach, NJ, was perhaps state's hardest-hit beach town, with virtually all 2,400 homes damaged and about 10 percent of them destroyed; many residents fighting to restore their lives say that Newtown, Conn, shootings cast new light on their plight, helping them to realize the cleanup, mostly about the loss of things rather than people, will somehow get done (Series: Coming Back).
lead_paragraph: Hurricane Sandy took a tremendous toll in Ortley Beach, N.J., but for some, the pain was tempered by the loss of life at Sandy Hook Elementary in Connecticut.

headline.seo: Hurricane Sandy and Sandy Hook Killings, Distinct but for a Name
headline.main: ‘We Lost Things and We Can Replace Those Things’
headline.print_headline: ‘We Lost Things and We Can Replace Those Things’
